venice.lib

Class AbstractSlot

  • java.lang.Object
    • venice.lib.AbstractSlot
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    SlotEvent

    public class AbstractSlot
extends java.lang.Object
    Describes a sensor slot by label, namespace and data type.

    Can be used for InstantIO namespace and RSB scope and possibly for other protocols.
    Every class, that represents a sensor slot (or "field") should extend this class.

    • Method Detail

      • getLabel

        public java.lang.String getLabel()
        Returns the name of the sensor. The name can include namespace- and scope-like information. Example: "OpenDS/Car/CarVelocity" can be a sensor name.
        Returns:
        Returns name of the sensor.

      • setLabel

        public void setLabel(java.lang.String name)
        Sets the name of the sensor. The name can include namespace- and scope-like information. Example: "OpenDS/Car/CarVelocity" can be a sensor name.
        Parameters:
        name - The new name of the sensor

      • getScope

        public java.lang.String getScope()
        Returns the Scope of this slot.

        A Scope consists of a Namespace and a Label. The part before the last slash is the Namespace and the part after the last slash is the Label.

        Example:
        The scope 'Venice/test/slotA' consists of the Namespace 'Venice/test' and the Label 'slotA'.

        If the namespace is MyNamespace and the label of the slot is SlotA, then the Scope will be MyNamespace/SlotA.

      • getType

        public java.lang.Class<?> getType()
        Returns the type of the sensor.
        Returns:
        Returns the type of the sensor
